org.jointheleague.cards

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jointheleague.cards.Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    A Deck consists of 52 Cards.
    Author:
    Erik Colban

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck(java.awt.Color color)
        Creates an instance of Deck containing exactly one instance of each of the 52 Cards.
        Parameters:
        color - color of the back of the cards. Must be either Color.BLUE or Color.RED.

      • Deck

        public Deck(java.net.URL url)
        Creates an instance of Deck containing exactly one instance of each of the 52 Cards. This constructor allows the caller to specify the image of the back of the cards in this deck by providing a URL to the image file.

        If the url is null or the file at the url is not found or cannot be read, the back of the cards is left blank.

        Parameters:
        url - The url of the image file containing the back image of the cards. This image should preferably have dimensions width = 75 and height = 107; otherwise it is scaled to those dimensions, and the quality may be poor.

    • Method Detail

      • getCard

        public Card getCard()
        Gets the next Card from this Deck of cards. The Card that is returned is random but different from any previously returned Card since the Deck was last shuffled.
        Returns:
        a Card instance, or null if no Cards are left

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(Card.Suit suit,
           int number)
        Gets a specific Card instance from the deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        suit - the suit of the card
        number - the number of the card
        Returns:
        a Card instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if number is out of range

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Gets the number of cards that are left in the Deck.
        Returns:
        the number of Cards left in the Deck

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffles the Deck.
